column1: Greetings, my name is Balfus. I am a Spirit Mentor. <t>*</t>My kind has trained untold generations of gladiators for honorable combat in this very arena. <t>*</t>Starting now, I'll be training you. <t>*</t>The first thing we need to cover is The Se-
column2: 你好，我叫巴尔福思，是个精神导师。<t>4.7</t>我的族人已经训练过无数角斗士参加这座超级角斗场的荣耀之战。<t>6.6</t>从现在起，我要对你进行训练。<t>4.1</t>我们要解决的第一件事就是挑——

column1: Greetings, my name is Balfus. I am a Spirit Mentor. <t>*</t>Starting now, I'll be training you. <t>*</t>The first thing we need to cover is The Se-
column2: 你好，我叫巴尔福思，是个精神导师。<t>4.7</t>从现在起，我要对你进行训练。<t>4.1</t>我们要解决的第一件事就是挑——

column1: Silence servant! I shall inspect the newest batch!
column2: 安静，仆人！我要检查这批新人！

column1: Pathetic! These scrawny slaves will not even make it through The Selection.
column2: 太可悲了！这些瘦巴巴的奴隶甚至连挑选试炼都过不了。

column1: Weaklings! Listen, your gods are not here! <t>5</t>You are livestock. Your people - livestock. <t>7</t>You are bred only to produce gladiators for us. <t>5</t>So far all you have produced are corpses.
column2: 弱鸡！听好了，你们的神不在这！<t>5</t>你是家畜。你的族人——也是家畜。<t>7</t>饲养你们的目的就只是为了给我们生产角斗士。<t>5</t>而到目前为止你们生产的全都是尸体。

column1: Weaklings! Listen, your gods are not here! <t>5</t>You are bred only to produce gladiators for us. <t>5</t>So far all you have produced are corpses.
column2: 弱鸡！听好了，你们的神不在这！<t>5</t>饲养你们的目的就只是为了给我们生产角斗士。<t>5</t>而到目前为止你们生产的全都是尸体。

column1: That was Wrathhoof, the first guardian. <t>*</t>You will meet him again soon enough. <t>*</t>Now, as I was saying, it is my sacred task to see you through The Selection... <t>*</t>or at least give you a fighting chance. Ready? Good.
column2: 那是怒蹄，第一个守护者。<t>3.7</t>你们很快就会再见的。<t>2.4</t>好了，正如我之前所说，我的神圣职责就是让你通过挑选试炼……<t>7</t>或者说至少得给你战斗的机会，准备好了吗？很好。

column1: Pick up a weapon, choose your style. <t>*</t>Each has a rich tradition. <t>*</t>Strengths, weaknesses... glory. <t>4.5</t>Don't worry too much about it, you can always change it later on.
column2: 挑选适合自己风格的武器吧。<t>3.8</t>每件武器都有着丰富的传统。<t>2.6</t>力量，缺点……荣耀。<t>4.5</t>别考虑太多，你之后随时能换。

column1: Try not to get hurt... too much.
Not bad. I think we can take this up a notch... <t>*</t>Let you feel your real powers. Are you ready? Excellent.
column2: 还不赖。<t>2</t>我想我们可以更进一步……让你感受自己真正的实力。<t>4.7</t>你准备好了吗？非常好。

column1: As gladiators you wield the power of marks. You will find them useful...
column2: 身为角斗士的你持有印记之力。你会发现它们非常有用……

column1: Behold! This worthy opponent can not be hurt by normal means, attack him now - use your marks.
column2: 注意！一般手段伤不到这位优秀的对手，现在攻击他——利用你的印记。

column1: You have now fully Marked him up. Now finish him!
column2: 你已经给他标上足够多的印记了。现在了结他吧！

column1: Very good, now do it again, from the top.
column2: 非常好，现在从头再来一遍。

column1: Your powers will have greater effect on enemies with many marks.
column2: 印记越多，你的力量就对敌人越有效。

column1: Let’s move on to more... complicated lessons.
column2: 让我们接着上更……复杂的课程吧。

column1: A gladiator must always be prepared. Understood? Great.
column2: 角斗士必须时刻做好准备。懂吗？非常好。

column1: Now, you must learn to harness the power of your Spirit Mentor - my power. <t>*</t>I can reach places you cannot, and help you greatly in the Trials - within the rules, of course. Try to call me.
column2: 现在，你得学会使用你精神导师的力量——也就是我的力量。<t>6.1</t>我能去到你无法到达的地方，而且能很大程度上帮助你的试炼——当然，规则还是要遵守。试着呼唤我吧。

column1: Excellent. Using what you’ve just learned, navigate me over the three Shrines to activate them.
column2: 很好，利用你方才所学，引导我去激活那三座神坛。

column1: Finally you must activate the Healing Shrine. <t>*</t>These are very useful, be sure to look for them in The Trials. It will save your lives.
column2: 最后你得激活那座治愈神坛。<t>3.2</t>这东西非常有用，一定要在试炼中找到它们。它能救你的命。

column1: A Marked enemy is a vulnerable enemy. Never forget it.
column2: 带有印记的敌人会比较弱。请牢记这一点。

column1: Now I deem you ready to-
column2: 现在，我相信你已经准备好去——

column1: Ready?! What a joke! <t>*</t>You might have survived The Selection weaklings, but you have a long way to go before I'll pass you.
column2: 准备好？！真是笑话！<t>4.1</t>你也许是通过了挑选试炼，弱鸡，但在我给你合格前，你还有好长的路要走。

column1: I swear he interrupts me on purpose!
column2: 我敢肯定他是故意打断我的！

column1: You've fought with honor so far - not everybody makes it through The Selection.
column2: 到目前为止你的战斗都很精彩——并非所有人都能通过挑选试炼。

column1: You've passed your first test! <t>*</t>Go now, to the Hall of Trials - there, your true test lies!
column2: 你已经通过第一项测试了！<t>3</t>去吧，去试炼大厅——在那里，有你真正的试炼！

column1: Go now, to the Hall of Trials - there, your true test lies!
column2: 去吧，去试炼大厅那——那里，有你真正的试炼！

column1: I have granted you the power of marks. Attack to apply marks $i4/$i5
column2: 我已经把印记之力给你了。利用攻击来附着印记（$i4/$i5）

column1: Finish off the marked target with an ability $i4/$i5
column2: 用能力来消灭带着印记的靶子（$i4/$i5）

column1: And again! Apply marks and use abilities to really harm $i4/$i5
column2: 再来！附着印记并用能力来破坏它（$i4/$i5）

column1: Okay, call me to a position
column2: 好了，呼唤我到一个位置

column1: Okay all, call me to a position $i4/$i5
column2: 好了大家，呼唤我到一个位置（$i4/$i5）

column1: Use the Healing Shrine to restore health
column2: 利用治愈神坛来恢复生命
击败蜂拥者之王，莫格鲁

column1: Challenge: Get to the Challenge Banner
Disrupt the Beam one last time $i4/$i5
Fill up the Timed Pressure Plates: $i4/$i5
Fill up the Timed Pressure Plates: $i4/$i5
Stand on the Timed Pressure Plate $i4/$i5
Find a way through the maze
Remember, you can ask me to follow you with a special call.
column2: 记住，你能通过特殊的呼唤来让我跟着你。

column1: Welcome, Gladiators, to the hall of Trials! <t>*</t>Within each of the Chambers, you will face trials of deadly combat – and eventually, its guardian.
column2: 欢迎来到试炼大厅，角斗士！<t>4</t>在这里的每个房间，你都将面对致命战斗的试炼——并最终面对它的守护者。

column1: Let us start with this one.
This we call the Preparation Room. The room between rooms. <t>5</t>Here you can change your battle gear, and prepare strategies.
column2: 我们称这里为准备室。房间之间的房间。<t>5</t>你能在这里更换你的装备，并筹划接下来的策略。

column1: Get ready, I’ll be sure to tell you what needs doing.
column2: 去做准备，我之后会把你要做的事情告诉你的。

column1: Well done – your progress is remarkable. <t>*</t>But beware, Wrathhoof will not be this easy - and he will not go easy on you. Understand? Good.
column2: 干得漂亮——你的进步非常明显。<t>3.8</t>不过要注意，面对怒蹄时可不会这么简单——他不会让你太好过的。懂了吗？很好。

column1: Very good, keep this up and you just might ..
column2: 非常好，保持这个状态，你也许……

column1: Just. Ignore him. Wrathhoof has forgotten where he came from - <t>*</t> - forgotten the meaning of honor. Most of the new Guardians have...
column2: 别管他。怒蹄已经忘记自己来自哪里——<t>5.7</t>——忘记荣耀的意义了。新的守护者大多已经……

column1: Your ferocity is impressive! Keep it up, and you may yet bring honour to your tribe.
column2: 你的狠样真让人难忘！保持这个状态，你或许能把荣耀带回自己的部落。

column1: You have beaten enough Trials! You have earned the right to face Wrath -
column2: 你已经通过足够多的试炼了！你有资格面对怒——

column1: Curse him twice. Were he not a Guardian I would...
column2: 吊他两次。他要不是守护者，我就……

column1: Go - face him, if you're ready. <t>*</t>However, know that besting a trial again, but with better results, can increase your power -<t>*</t>- and it just might improve your odds.
column2: 去吧——准备好了就去面对他吧。<t>4</t>不过，你要知道以更优异的成绩再次战胜以往的试炼能增强你的力量——<t>7.1</t>——以及提高你的胜率。

column1: Excellent, now you are truly ready to face the Guardian of this Chamber.
column2: 很好，现在你已经真正准备好面对这间房的守护者了。
哈啊，他一点都没有怀疑。

column1: The next chamber awaits you - but tread with care. I know its guardian personally... <t>*</t>and your fight, I’m afraid, has only just begun...
column2: 下一间房正等着你——不过去的时候小心点。我个人是知道它的守护者是谁的……<t>5.5</t>而且我担心你的战斗，只是刚刚开始……

column1: You think you've done enough to impress me? Pathetic! <t>*</t>You will die before I pass you – just like your ancestors did before you!
column2: 你觉得自己很厉害？真可悲！<t>5.3</t>在我给你合格前你就会死掉——就跟你的祖先一样！

column1: You think you've bested my Trials - Hah! <t>*</t>You think you're as strong as me? You think you're ready? I went easy on you!
column2: 你觉得自己已经战胜了我的试炼——哈！<t>3.9</t>你觉得自己和我一样厉害？你觉得自己已经准备好了？那是我没对你下重手！

column1: Your death belongs to me, and me alone – <t>*</t> – come before me! I'll show you a true challenge!
column2: 你的死亡是属于我的，我一个人的—— <t>4.8</t>——到我这来，我会让你见识下真正的挑战！

column1: Thank you for playing this demonstration of FORCED! Remember, you can re-play the previous Trials.
column2: 感谢你游玩《强迫》的Demo！别忘了，你可以重玩前面的试炼。

column1: Swarmers have corrupted these once great arenas.
column2: 蜂拥者破坏了这些曾经辉煌的角斗场。

column1: Remember, a Marked enemy is a vulnerable enemy.
column2: 别忘了，带有印记的敌人更加脆弱。

column1: Here, you fight or you die.
Your first trial is about to begin, stay calm and listen to my instructions... <t>*</t> and you just might live through it.
column2: 你的第一个试炼马上要开始了，保持安静，听我说明……<t>6.2</t>你也许需要靠它来活下去。

column1: Keep an eye on that hole. You can always be sure that danger lurks in such darkness.
column2: 眼睛注意那边的洞。无论什么时候你都可以认为危险就潜藏在这样黑暗的地方。

column1: Morgrul is approaching! This is what you've been training for.
column2: 莫格鲁要来了！你就是为此做的训练。

column1: Maybe you are not as weak as you first appeared.
column2: 也许你已经不像刚来时那么弱了。

column1: Be careful when using this shrines power, for your own sake.
column2: 为了你自己的安全，小心利用这些神坛的力量。

column1: Each statue takes 38 days to sculpt. A Gladiator takes 20-odd years.. <t>*</t> Guess which one is in short supply.
column2: 每尊雕像需要38天来雕刻。一个角斗士需要20多年来培养……<t>6.4</t>猜猜看哪个更短缺。

column1: Excellent! One statue left, show me what you can do!
column2: 很好！只剩一尊雕像了，证明给我看你能行！

column1: Good, focus on mastering my power. It will be needed later.
column2: 很好，集中精力掌握我的力量。之后会有用的。

column1: The power contained in these shrines can easily shatter stone. Or bones, for that matter. <t>*</t> Go ahead, try it on that statue over there.
column2: 这些神坛所蕴含的力量能轻易粉碎石头。同样的还有骨头。<t>6.4</t>继续，用那边的雕像试试看。

column1: Destroying statues like this is designed to test our ability to work together.
column2: 像这种摧毁雕像是设计就是用来测试我们的合作能力的。

column1: These nests produce swarmers until we get rid of them.
column2: 这些巢穴在被我们铲除前会一直孵化出蜂拥者。

column1: Use the Shockwave Shrine to effectively deal with many enemies.
column2: 利用震波神坛能有效地消灭大量敌人。

column1: The longer you leave them, the more dangerous they'll get.
column2: 你放置它们越久，它们就会变得越危险。

column1: Memorize what these look like, strike them down, wherever you see them.
column2: 记住这些东西的样子，一见到就要把它们干掉。

column1: Well done, you're getting the hang of this!
column2: 干得不错，你真是越来越上手了！

column1: This shrine will make you faster.. but only for a while. True skill comes from within.
column2: 这座神坛能让你变快……但只能持续一段时间。真正的技能源自内在。

column1: You must be very careful when I am volatile. Narrow spaces can prove deadly.
column2: 当我变得易爆时你得非常小心。狭窄的空间会变得非常致命。

column1: These barriers block your path, but enemies and - spirits - have no trouble crossing them.
column2: 这些屏障挡住了你的路，但敌人和——精神体——能无障碍穿过它们。

column1: A Cleaver is coming. Keep your wits about you!
Remember to always keep an eye on your surroundings!
column2: 别忘了要时刻关注周围的环境！

column1: These Acid Imps are honorless cowards.
column2: 这些酸液魔精是卑鄙的胆小鬼。

column1: The spit from the Acid Imps is so strong it can knock one off balance.
column2: 酸液魔精的唾液非常强力以至于它能打破人的平衡。

column1: Try your best to dodge the spit from the Acid Imps, or you will regret it.
column2: 尽可能躲开酸液魔精的唾液，不然你会后悔的。

column1: Against Acid Imps, you will hone your reflexes or die.
column2: 在对抗酸液魔精时，你要是不磨练反应就会死。

column1: The Mist will cripple even the greatest warriors.
column2: 即使是最强的战士遇到雾气也会变成跛子。

column1: Letting the Mist get out of hand is unwise.
column2: 让雾气脱离控制是不明智的。

column1: Prepare yourselves for the final push, remember all you've been taught!
column2: 准备好面对最后的攻势，别忘了之前教给你的那些！
保持精力集中非常重要。

column1: Try to keep calm when he does that.
column2: 在他做那件事时要保持不动。

column1: Stand still to maintain your balance.
column2: 站着别动，保持你的平衡。

column1: I’ve been wishing to defeat you for decades, you damnable beast!
column2: 我几十年前就想打败你了，你头可恶的野兽！

column1: Remember, staying calm is the key!
column2: 别忘了，保持不动是关键！

column1: Remember that brute force is not always the answer.
column2: 别忘了暴力不总是答案。

column1: Beware of his minions as well.
This time you will go down!
Contain your rage Wrathhoof, this is not what our master wishes.
column2: 收回你的怒气，怒蹄，这不是我们主人希望的。

column1: After countless fights I remain unbeaten, what hope have you?
column2: 历经无数战斗，我自岿然不败，你又有何希望呢？

column1: Your shiny bauble won't save you from my wrath!
column2: 你那闪亮的小装饰是无法从我的愤怒中拯救你的！

column1: Ready to take the bull by the horns?!
Bah! It is the only answer!
Let us see if you can even get to me!
column2: 就让我见识下你能不能来到我跟前！

column1: Cease! By the rules of the arena I declare the gladiators to be victorious. <t>*</t>Grant them your blessing Wrathhoof, and then prepare for the next group!
column2: 住手！根据角斗场的规则，我宣布角斗士胜出。<t>5.5</t>把你的祝福献给他们，怒蹄，然后为下一组作准备！

column1: Impossible! I will not be bested by tribesmen scum! <t>*</t>I will not accept this judgement!
column2: 不可能！我是不会被部落人渣战胜的！<t>6.1</t>我是不会接受这次裁决的！

column1: I command you to stop, Guardian! Have you no honor?!
column2: 我命令你停下，守护者！你难道没有荣耀感吗？！

column1: I don’t give a damn about your precious honor. I’ll squash these weaklings!  I'll show them -
column2: 我才不在乎你那珍贵的荣耀。我要踩死这些弱小的人！我要让他们见识下——

column1: You must fight! Fight for your lives!
column2: 你必须战斗了！为了活下去！

column1: Killing a Guardian is unthinkable! <t>*</t>The Master will surely have us all put to death - you, your tribe... even me. <t>*</t>Justice matters not to him.. *we* do not matter.
column2: 杀死守护者的后果是不堪设想的！<t>3.1</t>主人肯定会杀死我们所有人——你，你的族人……甚至是我。 <t>8.8</t>正义对他而言毫无所谓……*我们*对他而言也毫无所谓。

column1: We must move quickly. We must prove that we are valuable - profitable <t>*</t> - before someone finds out what we've done.
column2: 我们得赶紧走。我们必须证明自己是有用的——有价值的。<t>6</t>趁别人还没发现前。

column1: Come, The Master will be expecting us in the Hall.
column2: 过来，主人会在大厅中等我们的。

column1: You return - alive? <t>4</t>I will not lie, tribesmen - nobody has passed with Wrathhoof's blessing in... some time, now. Perhaps you might even prove profitable.
column2: 你活着——回来了？<t>4</t>我不会骗人，部落人——没人能够带着怒蹄的祝福通过试炼的……也许你能证明自己是有价值的。

column1: Your Tribe on the other hand, has been nothing but a waste of space. <t>*</t>Disappoint me, and I might have to .. replace them.
column2: 从另一方面说，你的部落除了浪费空间外就没什么用了。<t>5.8</t>他们让我失望至极，我可能得……换掉他们。

column1: This Chamber has broken more Gladiators than I care to count. In body and in spirit.
column2: 死在这间房里的角斗士已经多到我数不清了。不管是身体还是精神。

column1: The Guardian of this chamber calls himself Slarth – though he was not born to such a name. <t>*</t>He was once like you, you know – but now...
column2: 这间房里的守护者称自己为斯拉思——虽然他不是一出生就叫这个名字。<t>7.9</t>他以前跟你一样，你懂的——不过现在……

column1: We must watch our tongues in here. Slarth is always listening.
column2: 我们在这说话得小心。斯拉思一直在监听我们。

column1: We must not linger here. It's only a matter of time before the Master finds out what we've done.
column2: 我们不能在这逗留了。在主人发现我们的事前只有一点时间。

column1: The Chamber is complete, the exit is open.<t>*</t> Of course, if you want to add insult to injury, one puzzle still remains. <t>*</t> I believe it's one of.. his favorites.
column2: 这间房完成了，出口已经打开。<t>4.6</t>当然，如果你想在伤口上来把盐的话，这里还留有道谜题。 <t>5.8</t>我相信那是……他最喜欢的一个。

column1: I suppose it's only right that you know.  <t>*</t> Slarth was... an old pupil of mine. I mentored him like I mentor you now. <t>*</t> I led him through the trials. I saw him fight, I saw him live. Now I've seen him die.
column2: 我想你有权利知道这件事。 <t>3.1</t>斯拉思是……我过去的弟子。就像我现在指导你一样我过去也指导过他。 <t>7.9</t>我引导他通过试炼。看着他战斗，看着他存活。现在看着他死亡。

column1: You must press on. The next chamber awaits - and time is not on our side.
column2: 你必须前进。下间房正在等你——且时间不站在我们这一边。
巴尔福斯……好一阵子没见了。

column1: And who is it you bring with you? Did you finally manage to sneak someone past Wrath Hoof? You must tell us all about it.
column2: 以及你把谁带来了？你终于成功让人偷偷溜过怒蹄了？你得把这件事告诉我们大家。

column1: We'll see you all soon... Try not to die before then..
column2: 我们很快就会再见的……在此之前你就努力别死吧……

column1: You're awfully quiet, Balfus... Are you keeping something from us?
column2: 你太安静了，巴尔福斯……你是不是隐瞒了我们什么？

column1: It isn’t like you to keep a secret, Balfus. This is ... most puzzling.
column2: 保守秘密可不像你的行为，巴尔福斯。这……着实令人费解。

column1: We now know what you did, Balfus. You and your filthy charge. Come to our chambers. We need to... talk.
column2: 我们现在都知道你做了什么，巴尔福斯。你和你的臭弟子。来我们房间。我们需要……谈谈。

column1: You Killed a Chamber Guardian? Balfus, we must admit... we didn't think you'd have that in you. <t>*</t> Tell us... did you do it for your charge? For vengeance? <t>*</t> Or maybe... for satisfaction?
column2: 你杀了房间守护者？巴尔福斯，我们得承认……我们都不知道你有那样的能力。<t>8.2</t>告诉我们……你这样做是为了你的弟子吗？ 为了复仇？<t>5.9</t>又或是……为了自我满足？

column1: It matters not. We're going to tell the master – and then we're going to watch you die. Perhaps he'll feed you to all Graw?
column2: 无所谓了。我们要告诉主人——然后我们要看着你死。也许他会把你喂给所有葛洛？

column1: Oh, that would be... delightful. But first, old friend... We're going to teach you your place.
column2: 哦，那一定会……非常愉悦。但首先，老伙计……我们得让你明白自己的处境。

column1: In this trial you are bound to me, so keep close.
column2: 这项试炼你我是联系在一起的，所以贴紧点吧。

column1: It has been a while since I've seen this barren mountainside.
column2: 已经好一阵子没来看这里的贫瘠山坡了。

column1: These shrines can move, but not by physical strength. <t>*</t> A more.. spiritual touch is needed.
column2: 这些神坛是能够移动的，但用的不是物理上的力量。<t>4.7</t>而是需要更多的……精神接触。

column1: These creatures are very unstable, you better keep a safe distance.
column2: 这些怪物很不稳定，你最好与它们保持安全距离。

column1: Send me on my way with the moving shrine, you can always call upon me.
column2: 把我送到移动神坛那吧，你随时都能召唤我。

column1: The energy from these powerful crystals will incinerate your kin only.
column2: 这些强力水晶发出来的能量只会烧死你们。

column1: That shrine I've actually never seen before.. <t>*</t> Must be a new addition for this season.
column2: 老实说我之前从没见过那种神坛……<t>4.2</t>一定是这个季度新添加的。

column1: Remember to always keep an eye on your surroundings!
column2: 别忘了要时刻留意周围的情况！

column1: That's more like it, we're a team now!
column2: 我们现在真是越来越像个团队了！

column1: That's it, keep moving. I think you're starting to get this.
column2: 没错，继续前进。我看你是越来越懂了。

column1: We're nearing Slarth's own chambers. <t>*</t> You're doing great. Don't give in.
column2: 我们快到斯拉思的房间了。<t>2.3</t>你做得很好。不要认输。

column1: Slarths challenges have never been known to be fair - nor predictable. <t>*</t> Play along. But be careful.
column2: 斯拉思的挑战从来都没有过公平——且无法预测。 <t>5.7</t>暂时附和他吧。不过要小心。

column1: A Gladiator needs brains as well as brawn. At least Slarth hasn't forgotten that.
column2: 角斗士需要体力，也需要智力。至少斯拉思没有忘记这一点。

column1: When Slarth closes a door.. <t>*</t> You'll just have to find a window.
column2: 当斯拉思关闭一扇门时……<t>2.4</t>你必须找到另一扇窗户。

column1: One misstep here might be your last.
column2: 这里走错一步便会万劫不复。

column1: Very impressive! I already knew the solution of course, but to the best of my knowledge you're the first Gladiators to solve it.<t>*</t> Slarth will not be happy to hear this.
column2: 太厉害了！虽然我早已知道答案，但据我所知，你是第一个解决这问题的角斗士。<t>9.7</t>斯拉思听到这事肯定没好脸色。

column1: What manner of foul sorcery is this?!
By the Ancestors! Slarth has really outdone himself this time.
column2: 以先祖之名！斯拉思这次真的超越自己了。

column1: This shrine will be most helpful.<t>*</t> After we've powered it up, it will strike down all enemies who venture too near.
column2: 这座神坛会很有帮助。<t>2.8</t>我们启动它后，它就会把所有靠近的敌人都打倒。

column1: This seems a simple task.  <t>*</t>But stay on your guard. With Slarth, nothing is ever as simple as it seems.
column2: 这任务看似简单。<t>2.2</t>但你还是要保持警惕。有斯拉思在，没什么事是简单的。

column1: Touch the banner to claim victory, ignore all else!
column2: 快碰那旗帜来宣告胜利，其它的都别管了！

column1: Well done! That one even had me stumped!
column2: 做得好！就连我都被那东西给难住了！

column1: These statues are beyond your powers! Run, run as fast as you can!
column2: 这些雕像的力量远在你之上！快跑，尽全力跑！

column1: I knew Slarth, since he was a Gladiator himself. Not unlike you... <t>*</t>Too much has changed since then.
column2: 我知道斯拉思，因为他自己就是个角斗士。和你没有区别……<t>6.3</t>那之后有太多事改变了。

column1: I have failed you as a trainer Slarth .. forgive me
column2: 身为你的教练我辜负了你，斯拉思……原谅我。

column1: Power is no replacement for Honor!
Stay away when he uses his curses on me!
column2: 在他对我使用诅咒时离远点！

column1: I know all your tricks, I taught them!
column2: 我知道你所有的诡计，是我教他们的！

column1: You have always been weak, Balfus!
column2: 你一直都那么弱，巴尔福斯！

column1: Is murder your notion of honour now? Truly you have changed.
column2: 杀人就是你现在的荣耀吗？你真的变了。

column1: Stone to life.. A simple spell for the likes of me.
column2: 活石术……对我来说是个简单的法术。
起来吧，雕像！保护你的主人！
不，呵呵呵呵。你什么都不懂。

column1: The next chamber was once a lush forest. But like it's Guardian it has.. changed.<t>*</t> Now it is but a bloated, corrupted shadow of it's former self.
column2: 下间房曾是郁郁葱葱的森林。不过就像它的守护者一样，那里……也变了。<t>9.8</t>现在那里只有以前残留下来的浮肿且腐败的影子。

column1: We must fight our way to his chamber and stem the corruption at its source.
column2: 我们必须去他的房间，从源头上阻止腐化。

column1: That monster was Graw. If you must fall in battle, do not fall here.  <t>*</t>Too many of your kin already have. Too many have added to his bulk -  <t>*</t> and to his ego.
column2: 那头怪物就是葛洛。如果你非得战死，请不要死在这里。<t>9</t>你的族人已经有太多死在这里了。有太多人变成了他的体重——<t>6.7</t>以及他的自负。

column1: You've fought back the corruption, but the source remains. Graw grows hungrier by the minute.
column2: 你击退了腐败，但它的源头依然存在。葛洛每过一分钟都会变得更饥饿。

column1: You are wise in preparing yourself. This next fight will be a true test of your skill and our bond.
column2: 你知道做准备真是非常明智。下场战斗会是测试你技能和我们羁绊的真正试炼。

column1: Balfus! How good of you to come visit.
column2: 巴尔福斯！你能来真是太好了。

column1: Too few make it past Slarth these days... I am positively famished for a good fight! <t>*</t> Please - tell me this group is bigger than the last ones you brought me!
column2: 这些日子很少有人能够通过斯拉思……我非常渴望来一场精彩的战斗！<t>10.8</t>拜托你——告诉我你带来的这批人比上一次的要大！

column1: Must you struggle so? Your death is inevitable, and my children hunger. <t>*</t> Why must you make this so hard on us all?
column2: 你非得这么挣扎吗？你的死已是无法避免，而且我的孩子还饿着肚子呢。<t>9.4</t>你为什么要弄得我们大家都那么不容易呢？

column1: Yes... Come to me! I promise you, little tribesmen... it'll be a feast.
column2: 没错……来我这里！我向你保证，小部落人……这会是一场盛宴。

column1: This healing shrine is infested! Even the shrines are no longer safe here!
column2: 这座治愈神坛被感染了！在这里连神坛都不再安全！

column1: These infested shrines will lash out as I cleanse them, stay clear!
column2: 这些受感染的神坛会在我们净化时攻击我们，躲开！

column1: Now get close to it! Once cleansed, the shrine will let loose one last healing burst!
column2: 现在靠近它吧！神坛一旦被净化，它就会爆发出最后的治疗波！

column1: One left, don't lose your focus!
The corruption of this chamber must be kept in check!
column2: 必须控制住这间房的腐化！

column1: Graws corruption is not only of the flesh.. This was once a beautiful forest.
column2: 葛洛的腐化不止作用于肉体……这里曾经是片美丽的森林。

column1: Getting rid of these Infested Shrines prevent any further corruption.
column2: 清掉受感染的神坛以防止进一步腐化。

column1: Use their own charge against them!  <t>*</t>There are thicker things in here than their heads.
column2: 反过来利用它们的冲刺来对付它们！<t>2.8</t>这里有比它们头更硬的东西。

column1: These Blood Carriers can mend the wounds of their wicked kin, take them out fast!
column2: 这些血包携带者能治疗它们邪恶眷属的伤口，要快点处理掉它们！

column1: Graw’s infestation has even created a deadly Blood Mist! Run for your lives!
column2: 葛洛的腐化侵袭甚至创造出了致命的血雾！不想死就快跑！

column1: Keep moving, even the air cannot be trusted in here!
column2: 继续前进，在这里连空气都不能相信。

column1: Kill this foe quickly, he blocks our way!
column2: 快消灭这个敌人，他挡住了我们的路！

column1: The infested shrine is Graw's favorite creation.  <t>*</t>How he merged it with a creature I'd rather not know.
column2: 受感染的神坛是葛洛最得意的作品。<t>4.3</t>至于他是怎么把它和怪物合在一起的，我情愿不知。

column1: This trial smells foul beyond all sense. I feel a great corruption, yet I see nothing!
column2: 这项试炼的恶臭已超过了其它所有感知。我能感觉到一股巨大的腐败，虽然我还没看到任何东西！

column1: Make sure to keep the infestation at bay, or you'll drown under their sheer numbers!
column2: 一定要持续压制住腐化的侵袭，不然你会被它庞大的数量给淹没的！

column1: Make good use of the infested shrines dying healing burst!
column2: 利用好受感染神坛在临死前爆发出的治疗波！

column1: This obstacle will require patience and precisison to overcome!
column2: 这次的阻碍需要耐心与细致来解决！

column1: Graw - being the greedy bastard he is, couldn’t decide which death traps he wanted, so he used them all.
column2: 葛洛——那个贪心的混蛋不知道要用哪个死亡陷阱，所以他把所有陷阱都用上了。

column1: Be careful, if the Acid Imps unbalance you at the wrong moment, the beam will catch you!
column2: 当心，你要是在错误的时机被酸液魔精打乱了平衡，就会被光束给击中！

column1: There are sinister Warlocks in these parts.
column2: 这片区域有邪恶的术士。
以先祖之名，他……也太大了！

column1: Fight, fight like you've never fought before!
column2: 战斗吧，就像你之前从未战斗过一样！

column1: You are but a symptom of this systems sickness!
column2: 你就是这系统疾病里的病症！

column1: By my power I shall cleanse this place.
column2: 我要用我的力量净化此地。

column1: This used to be such a beautiful glade ..
column2: 这里曾是美丽的林中空地……

column1: Yes! Run and fight and flee and hide!  <t>*</t>I'll catch your little tribelings in the end, Balfus... I always do!
column2: 哇，哈哈，哈哈！<t>3.2</t>没错！跑吧，打吧，逃吧，躲吧！<t>6.3</t>到最后我都会抓住你的小部落人的，巴尔福斯……我从没失过手！

column1: Stop struggling food, you'll get stringy!
column2: 别挣扎了，食物，你会变柴的！

column1: My ever-living minions will take care of you.
column2: 我那永生的随从会好好关照你的。
我的腐化侵袭是无法被阻止的。

column1: Come little ones. Help your papa Graw.
column2: 过来，小家伙。来帮帮你的爸爸葛洛。

column1: Let us play .. hide and slay!
Your corpse will feed my .. progress.
column2: 你的尸体将填饱我的……肚子。

column1: Where is the honor? Where is the glory?  <t>*</t>He was never a worthy gladiator – much less a guardian. <t>*</t> But the new master cares not for tradition. It needs to end.
column2: 荣耀在哪？荣誉又在哪？<t>4.8</t>他从来都不是个值得敬佩的角斗士——比角斗士差远了。<t>4.2</t>但新主人并不在意传统。必须结束这种状况。

column1: Moon Gore - If you'll stand by my side, we could tear this down – stone by wretched stone! <t>*</t>Come... The road ahead is shortening – but the hardest fights have yet to come. For now, the next chamber awaits.
column2: 月血人——如果你站在我这边，我们就能把这东西给拆掉——逐块石头逐块石头地！<t>11</t>过来……虽然前方的路已越来越短——但最艰难的战斗即将到来。<t>7.4</t>而现在，下间房正等着你。

column1: What has become of this place?! <t>*</t> Graw was never a worthy Gladiator, much less a Guardian!<t>*</t> The new Master cares not for Tradition. Profits? Hah! <t>5</t> This needs to end! <t>*</t> Come... The road ahead is shortening – but the hardest fights have yet to come. For now, the next chamber awaits.
column2: 这地方都成什么样了？！<t>3.1</t>葛洛从来都不是个值得敬佩的角斗士，比角斗士差多了！<t>5.4</t>新主人并不在意传统。利益？哈！<t>6.1</t>必须结束这种状况！<t>3.6</t>过来……虽然前方的路已越来越短——但最艰难的战斗即将到来。<t>7.2</t>而现在，下间房正等着你。

column1: Did you honestly think I wouldn't find out?
column2: 你真以为我会发现不了吗？

column1: Do you know how much you’ve cost me?!
column2: 你知道你让我付出了多少代价吗？

column1: This costly debacle ends here. <t>4</t>I have instructed Mordar to end your pitiful lives – <t>5</t> yes Balfus, that includes you.  <t>6</t>You may consider yourself... fired.
column2: 这种代价高昂的败北就到此为止吧。<t>4</t>我已经下令让魔达来结束你们那卑微的生命了——<t>5</t>没错，巴尔福斯，包括你。<t>6</t>你可以认为自己已经……被炒了。

column1: Mordar! End their lives! Let loose your experiments!
column2: 魔达！去结束他们的生命！把你的实验体放出来！

column1: As you command, my lord and liege!
Hahahaha! Welcome to my Chamber, watch your step! Hahahaha!  <t>8</t>The set is set, the show is starting... think you got what it takes to see how it ends?
column2: 哈哈哈哈！欢迎来到我的房间，当心你脚下吧！哈哈哈哈！<t>8</t>东西已经设置好了，演出即将开始……想你已经知道需要什么才能看到它如何结束？

column1: Hehehehe. Good, Excellent – Go on,  <t>6</t>the show has just begun – a shame if you would die before the end! Hahaha!
column2: 呵呵呵呵。很好，很棒——继续，<t>6</t>演出才刚刚开始——你要是在中途死掉的话就太可惜了！哈哈哈！

column1: And now... the crescendo! In the right corner – Balfus and his human lackeys! <t>8</t> In the left... me! Hahhaha! What more, could an audience ask for?
column2: 而现在……就是高潮！右边角落——是巴尔福斯和他的人类走狗！<t>8</t>而左边……则是我！哈哈哈！这阵容观众还会有什么不满吗？

column1: Tortured screams still linger in these very stones. This tower has seen the end of many..
column2: 那些痛苦的尖叫依然回荡在这些石头中。这座塔已经见证过太多人的末路了……

column1: You're making good progress! But don't relax yet. Stay focused, stay alive.
column2: 你已经取得了很大的进步！不过别掉以轻心，保持专注，不要送死。

column1: Good, you'll need every bit of practice you can get if you're to fight The Master's favored Guardian.
column2: 很好，如果你想和主人最喜欢的守护者开战的话，那你不能错过任何一项练习。

column1: These halls are filled with death and darkness.. stay alert.
column2: 这些大厅充满了死亡与黑暗……保持警惕。

column1: Be careful, the shadows have teeth..
column2: 小心点，危机的獠牙就潜藏在阴影里……

column1: Be careful, these grinders are just as dangerous as they look.
column2: 小心点，这些尖刺装置正如它们外表一样危险。

column1: Keep my light close, enemies can come from any angle in here.
column2: 紧贴着我的光，这里的敌人会从各个方向袭来。

column1: Good, keep it up and we'll have this solved in no time!
column2: 很好，继续保持，我们很快就能解决这个问题！

column1: Mordar is a powerful mage, capable of manipulating the spirit realm and my connection to you
column2: 魔达是个强力的法师，他能控制精神领域以及你我之间的联系。

column1: Just one Warlock stands between us and victory! Truly I pity him.
column2: 只有一个术士站在我们与胜利之间！我真为他感到可怜。

column1: Come on, the rest of them should be nearby!
column2: 走吧，剩下的应该就在附近！

column1: Take care here, the Warlocks are not as stupid as the other enemies
column2: 在这里要小心，术士可不会像其它敌人那么傻。

column1: Mordar cares not what is caught in his traps. All death pleases him.
column2: 魔达根本不关心他的陷阱抓到了什么。任何死亡都能取悦他。

column1: I know not for what nefarious purpose Mordar has created this device, but I know destroying it will hinder his plans!
column2: 虽然我不知道魔达创造这台装置有什么罪恶目的，但我知道摧毁它能阻碍他的计划！

column1: The dark hunters shroud themselves in magical darkness that can only be pierced by magic
column2: 黑暗猎手会用黑暗魔法裹住自己，只有魔法才能打穿它。

column1: A miniature Graw?! Could this machine be creating them? We must destroy it!

column1: All weapons add marks with their basic attacks. Marks can be spent by any player and will often make active skills more powerful.
column2: 所有武器的基础攻击都能附着印记。任何玩家都能把印记消耗掉，且印记经常会被用来加强主动技能。

column1: Balfus is your companion in the arenas, but you have to tell him where to go! Use your spirit call to navigate him over shrines and other points of interest in the arenas.
column2: 在角斗场里巴尔福斯就是你的搭档，不过你得告诉他要往哪走！用你的精神呼唤来引导他至神坛或角斗场里其它令人在意的地方。

column1: Collecting crystals enables more skills in all weapons for all players. There are three crystals to be earned in each trial.
column2: 收集水晶能让玩家的所有武器觉醒更多的技能。每项试炼都能收集到三颗水晶。

column1: Bombs are dangerous for all who inhabit the arena, remember to place the orb often when calling them.
column2: 炸弹对所有角斗场里的人来说都是件危险的东西，别忘了在呼唤它们时多多放置光球。

column1: Activator shrines usually trigger some event when lit, be sure to be ready before lighting them.
column2: 激活神坛在被点亮时通常会触发某些事件，所以在点亮前一定要做好充分的准备。

column1: Remember to keep spawner shrines disrupted or you will be overwhelmed.
column2: 别忘了对孵化神坛进行持续干扰，不然你会被敌人的数量淹没的。

column1: Swarmers become more dangerous when they crowd together, be sure to crop their population often.
column2: 成群的蜂拥者会变得更危险，一定要常常削减它们的数量。

column1: It helps to assign a Boss-watcher among you, who calls out when Wrathhoof stomps.
column2: 在你身边安排个Boss观测器会很有用，它会在怒蹄要使用践踏时发出呼叫。

column1: Calling the orb immediately after being charged will make sure that you get free as fast as possible.
column2: 被撞倒后立即呼唤光球能确保你尽快脱身。

column1: Some abilities and classes are great for eliminating groups of swarmers at a time.
column2: 某些能力和职业对成群的蜂拥者非常有优势。

column1: The bow will need protection from the swarmers.
column2: 需要从蜂拥者那保护好弓箭。

column1: Keeping constant control of the mist is essential for defeating it.
column2: 保持对雾气的控制是击败它的关键。

column1: Position yourselves on opposite sides of the mist and alternately call the orb to control the mist.
column2: 边让自己到雾气对面，边呼唤光球来控制雾气。

column1: Be sure not to get caught in dead ends, they have that name for a reason.
column2: 别在死路中被抓住，死字可不是白叫的。

column1: The brawler is easy to dodge when isolated, but becomes deadly with backup.
column2: 单独一个争斗者很容易躲避，但它有了支援后就会变得非常致命。

column1: Calling the orb immediately after being charged ensures the swiftest possible escape.
column2: 被撞倒后立即呼唤光球能确保你迅速逃开。

column1: If you get charged, make sure that your teammates know not to use the orb, so that you can free yourself.
column2: 你要是被撞倒了，一定别让你的队友使用光球，这样你才能让自己脱身。

column1: Acid Imps are easily taken care of when focusing on dodging them, but they become a nuisance if ignored.
column2: 只要集中精神躲避，很容易就能应付酸液魔精，但要是忽视的话，它们就会变得非常麻烦。

column1: When dealing with Acid Imps, having a decoy can sometimes help to close on them.
column2: 在对付酸液魔精时使用诱饵偶尔能帮你靠近他们。

column1: To keep down the mist it helps to place the orb on one side of the mist and move to the other side before calling.
column2: 把光球放在雾气一侧，然后移动到另外一侧进行呼唤，这种做法能帮你控制住雾气。

column1: The heal shrine can completely restore your health every 40th second, be sure to make good use of it.
column2: 只需40秒治愈神坛就能完全恢复你的生命，一定要好好利用它。

column1: To fully make use of the heal shrine, the team must stay together for the duration.
column2: 为了充分利用治愈神坛，治疗期间队伍最好待在一起。

column1: Shockwave shrines can not only give you a break in the action, but also kill enemies that are launched in to the wall.
column2: 震波神坛不仅能在行动中给你喘息的机会，还能把撞到墙上的敌人给消灭掉。

column1: Leaving the orb on the other side of the shockwave shrine gives you the possibility to trigger it at any time by calling.
column2: 把光球留在震波神坛的一侧，这样你就能随时呼唤光球来触发神坛了。

column1: The Volatile Runners can be quite devastating to their own ranks if caused to explode to early.
column2: 如果能早点引发爆炸的话，爆炸狂奔者对于它们的队伍来说会是个大灾难。

column1: Any damage causes the volatile runner to explode prematurely, use this for justice!
column2: 任何伤害都能让爆炸狂奔者提早爆炸，把它用在正义事业上吧！

column1: Sometimes, pausing the game to figure out a particularly hard puzzle can be helpful.
column2: 游戏暂停在解决特难谜题方面非常有帮助。

column1: Make sure to inform your fellow gladiators if you want them to call the orb.
column2: 如果你想要你的角斗士同伴呼唤光球的话，一定要通知他们。

column1: You can freely swap your weapon at any time and keep the same amount of unlocks.
column2: 你随时都能换武器，而且解锁不会因此变少。

column1: You can read about weapons or skills using the info button from the skill menu.
column2: 你可以用技能菜单中的信息键来阅读武器或技能的相关情报。

column1: When the orb is attached to a cube shrine, remember that calling it to a position makes the shrine move, while calling the orb to you will make it leave the shrine.
column2: 当光球和立体神坛联在一起时，别忘了呼唤光球来移动神坛。当你召回光球时，它会离开神坛。

column1: If you're having trouble with a Trial, try looking around the arena for power shrines or alternate approaches to completing the objectives.
column2: 如果你在试炼中遇到了困难，尝试在角斗场周围找找看力量神坛或者以替换方案完成目标。

column1: Completing objectives oftentimes leads to the trial progressing to a harder stage. Don't rush them if you're not ready for the heat.
column2: 经常完成任务会让试炼进度往更难的方向推进。你要是还没准备好的话，就不要把进度推得太猛。

column1: When the deadline is present, think carefully before calling the orb, it might hurt your allies.
column2: 在死线出现时，呼唤光球一定要慎重，它有可能会伤害到你的同伴。

column1: The Living Statues are impervious to your attacks, you will have to use another source of damage if you wish to fight them
column2: 你的攻击对活体雕像无效，你要是想和它们战斗的话，就得依靠其它伤害手段。

column1: Keep an eye on the orb throughout the fight, Slarth may be using it against you..
column2: 整场战斗你都得盯紧光球，斯拉思有可能会用它来对付你……

column1: Don't let Slarth steal too much of your health when he pins you. To escape quickly you must keep the orb close, if you dare..
column2: 当斯拉思固定你时别让他偷去太多生命。为了尽快脱离你得让光球靠近你，如果你够勇气的话……

column1: Slarth has no compunctions towards sacrificing swarmers for his own gain, sometimes, killing them fast can prevent him from using his flesh blink.
column2: 斯拉思为了自己会毫不犹豫地牺牲掉蜂拥者，有时候，快速消灭它们能阻止他使用瞬身术。

column1: Don't fight too close to infested shrines, they heal enemies.
column2: 战斗时别过于靠近那些受感染的神坛，它们会给敌人回血。

column1: Be careful when cleansing infested shrines, as knockback can push you out of the deadline.
column2: 在净化受感染的神坛时要当心，因为它有可能会把你击退至死线之外。

column1: The gasses in the blood swamp aren't deadly, but they're suffocating enough that you can't run inside them.
column2: 血沼里的气体并不会致命，不过它会让你呼吸困难，无法在它里面跑动。

column1: Remember that staying near an infested srhine as the infestation is cleansed will heal you once the energy of the shrine is released.
column2: 别忘了当你待在受感染的神坛附近时，一旦神坛被净化，它释放的能量能够恢复你的生命。

column1: Don't get caught in both the mist and a gas cloud, you will almost be unable to move.
column2: 别被雾气和毒云抓住，不然你很难移动。

column1: Be careful when inside gas clouds, it will be harder to dodge the most powerful enemy attacks.
column2: 身处毒云中时要小心，强力敌人的攻击会变得很难躲避。

column1: The warlocks are powerful spellcasters but weak of body, an offensive strategy is recommended
column2: 虽然术士是非常强力的魔法咏唱者，但它的肉体却很脆弱，推荐使用较为主动的战法。

column1: Warlocks are elusive, and will do their best to escape you using their Flesh Blink. Deny them the opportunity by removing swarmers from the arena before you corner them.
column2: 术士是非常难抓到的，它们会全力使用瞬身术来避开你。要想把它们逼进绝路，就要先除掉角斗场的蜂拥者，以免给它们使用瞬身术的机会。

column1: The knockback from a Shockwave shrine can be used to kill boomers if they hit a wall.
column2: 被震波神坛击退的敌群如果撞到墙就会被消灭。

column1: Light shrines can give you more space while cleansing infested shrines.
column2: 点亮神坛在你净化神坛时给予你更多空间。

column1: Big enemies like the Brawler or Taurus gain the most healing from fighting near infested shrines because they can't be killed quickly
column2: 由于你无法快速消灭像争斗者或塔卢斯这样的大家伙，所以它们能从受感染的神坛中获得最多的治疗。

column1: Be careful around orb barriers when warlocks are close, if the orb cannot get to you as you get pinned there is no mercy from the arena masters
column2: 当术士靠近时要担心周围的光球屏障，一旦你被固定且光球无法到达你的位置，可别指望角斗场主人会怜悯你。

column1: Be careful around orb barriers when a warlock is close, if the orb cannot get to you as you get pinned, only allies can save you by disrupting his casting.
column2: 当术士靠近时要担心周围的光球屏障，一旦你被固定且光球无法到达你的位置，就只能依靠同伴来打断他的施法。

column1: Graw is also healed by infested shrines, and his size makes it difficult to lead him around them. Likely, your only chance to avoid it is to cleanse them..
column2: 受感染的神坛也能为葛洛恢复生命，而且因为他体型的缘故，你很难让他绕开神坛。也就是说，要避免这种情况的唯一方法就是净化它们……

column1: If you don't take care of the Elite Volatile Swarmer eggs often, you will find their population growing out of control.
column2: 你要是未对精英爆炸蜂拥者的卵进行控制的话，你将发现它们的数量增长会失去控制。

column1: Having trouble removing the Elite Volatile Runners? Maybe the orb can be of help..
column2: 对除掉精英爆炸狂奔者感到棘手？也许那颗光球能帮得上忙……

column1: When Graw begins his summoning phase you will have to balance removing Elite Volatile Runners and disrupting spawner shrines. But the most important thing is to keep them from getting to him!
column2: 当格劳开始他的召唤阶段时，你要平衡好除掉精英爆炸狂奔者以及破坏孵化者神坛两项任务。不过最重要的是它们去到格劳那里！

column1: Shield brawlers are most powerful when other enemies are near that can benefit from the buff.
column2: 持盾争斗者在附近有其它敌人时最为强大，因为那些敌人能获得Buff的加持。

column1: Remember that Shield Brawlers heal the damage they have taken if you stop attacking them.
column2: 别忘了持盾争斗者在你没有攻击它们时会给自己加血。

column1: If something is very hard, consider going back and earning more crystals from previous trials. New skills or perks might help.
column2: 要是遇到了棘手的关卡，可以考虑回到先前的试炼去收集更多的水晶。新的技能或特性也许会有帮助。

column1:
Sir Kristos the Brave.
 Few fight alone in the arenas, for long at least.
 Sir Kristos however, became the first solo Champion
 and went on to win several solo championships.
 Unfortunately, nobody stays a champion.
column2:
勇者克里斯托斯先生
几乎没有人会在角斗场里单打独斗，至少很久都没有。
然而，克里斯托斯先生却成为了第一位单打冠军，
且后来还赢得了数场单打比赛的胜利。
可惜，没有人能一直是冠军。

column1:
Bal'dur the Hideous.
 A swarmer pup caught by a cunning tribeswoman to replace
 her son for The Selection, Bal'dur was raised among tribesmen,
 learning discipline and intelligence beyond any swarmer.
 Despite their efforts, he left them with the words;
 "Bal'dur hungry. Hope humans living down there. Humans tasty."
column2:
丑者博德
一位狡猾的部落女人捕获了一只蜂拥者幼崽来替代她儿子参与试炼，
博德是由部落人养大的，他比任何蜂拥者都要懂得纪律与智慧。
尽管人们付出了很多努力，但博德依然给他们留下了这些话：
“博德好饿。希望那下面有人类居住。人类美味。”

column1:
Rhalst.
 Balfus' favorite Gladiator, not for his fighting skills,
 but for his mirth and charisma.
 The winner of multiple tournaments,
 no-one knows what happened to him.
column2:
拉尔斯特
巴尔福斯最喜欢的角斗士，不是因为他的战斗技巧，
而是因为他的欢笑与魅力。
他是多场比赛的胜者，没人知道他出了什么事。
